title: Treasure Trails/Strategies

properties.name: description
properties.value: See this page for suggested methods of obtaining clue scrolls as well as for the most efficient setups for completing clue scrolls.

content:
See this page for suggested methods of obtaining clue scrolls as well as for the most efficient setups for completing clue scrolls.

Contents

  • 1 Clue scroll sources
    • 1.1 Opening impling jars
    • 1.2 Other methods
      • 1.2.1 Beginner clue scrolls
      • 1.2.2 Easy clue scrolls
      • 1.2.3 Medium clue scrolls
      • 1.2.4 Hard clue scrolls
      • 1.2.5 Elite clue scrolls
      • 1.2.6 Master clue scrolls
  • 2 Setups
  • 3 Solving the Treasure Trails

Clue scroll sources[edit | edit source]

Opening impling jars is by far the quickest method to find clue scrolls. For some clue scroll levels it can get rather expensive however. Therefore there'll also be some other methods being mentioned in this section.

Opening impling jars[edit | edit source]

Clue scroll level Impling jar Droprate Average cost per clue
Beginner Baby 1/50
Young 1/25
Easy Baby 1/100
Young 1/50
Gourmet 1/25 −99,447
Medium Earth 1/100
Essence 1/50
Eclectic 1/25 −103,101
Hard Nature 1/100 −353,141
Magpie 1/50 −373,083
Ninja 1/25 −666,581
Elite Crystal 1/50
Dragon 1/50 −15,327,380

Other methods[edit | edit source]

See this section for the best methods outside opening impling jars. Click the links below for a complete list of drop sources.

Beginner clue scrolls[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue scroll (beginner) § Drop sources
  • Killing Bryophyta or Obor for a guaranteed beginner clue scroll drop.
  • Killing hill giants for a 1/50
  • Killing minotaurs for a 1/60 drop rate of a beginner clue scroll.

Easy clue scrolls[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue scroll (easy) § Drop sources
  • Pickpocketing H.A.M. Members for a 1/50 chance of an easy clue scroll.
  • Killing thugs with a ring of wealth (i) equipped for a 1/64 drop rate.
  • Killing swamp crabs for a 1/96 drop rate.
  • Killing goblins for a 1/128 drop rate of an easy clue scroll. Their low hitpoints and great numbers in a tight space make it very easy for players to get clue scrolls this way.

Medium clue scrolls[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue scroll (medium) § Drop sources
  • Killing guards in Falador, after completion of the Falador medium diary, for a 1/106 drop rate of a medium clue scroll.
  • Killing pyrefiends in the Wilderness God Wars Dungeon with a ring of wealth (i) equipped for a 1/64 drop rate of a medium clue scroll.
  • Looting the Stone chest for a 1/100 rate of a medium clue scroll drop rate. The fast respawn can compensate for the lower rate.

Hard clue scrolls[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue scroll (hard) § Drop sources
  • Killing hellhounds in wilderness with a ring of wealth (i) equipped for a 1/32 drop rate of a hard clue scroll.
  • Killing Skotizo for a guaranteed hard clue scroll.
  • Killing warped jellies for a drop rate 1/64 as well as additional ones through totem pieces they drop.
  • Killing the Dagannoth Kings for a 1/42 drop rate of a hard clue scroll.
  • Killing Sarachnis for a 1/40 drop rate of a hard clue scroll.
  • Looting the Rogue chest for a 1/99 drop rate.

Elite clue scrolls[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue scroll (elite) § Drop sources
  • Killing Skotizo for a 1/5 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
  • Killing lava dragons with a ring of wealth (i) equipped for a 1/125 chance of an elite clue scroll.
  • Killing Sarachnis for a 1/60 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
  • Looting the Barrows chest after killing all six Barrows brothers for a 1/33 chance of an elite clue scroll.
  • Killing Callisto, Venenatis or Vet'ion with a ring of wealth (i) equipped for a 1/50 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
  • Killing Vorkath for a 1/65 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
  • Killing Zulrah for a 1/75 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.

Master clue scrolls[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue scroll (master) § Drop sources
  • Giving one of each easy, medium, hard and elite clues to Watson in exchange for a master clue scroll.
  • Completing an easy clue scroll for a 1/50 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.
  • Completing a medium clue scroll for a 1/30 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.
  • Completing a hard clue scroll for a 1/15 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.
  • Completing an elite clue scroll for a 1/5 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.

Setups[edit | edit source]

Main article: Treasure Trails/Full guide

See the sections below for the most efficient setups for each clue scroll level. For more information see their individual guides on the page linked above.

Beginner clues (free-to-play)[edit | edit source]

200200
200200
20010000
1000
1000

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Use the skull sceptre to teleport to the Stronghold of Security to kill minotaurs for beginner clue scrolls.
  • Use the right skull halves dropped by the minotaurs to recharge the skull sceptre.
  • The chef's hat can be swapped for any full helm if more defence bonuses are needed.
  • If your Defence level is high enough to easily kill minotaurs, you can choose to bank the platebody and legs for weight reduction purposes.
  • A black pickaxe is preferred, since it weighs 0 kg, thus saving a bit of run energy over any other pickaxe.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Raw trout Raw pike Iron bar
Needle Leather Thread
Hammer

Beginner clues (members)[edit | edit source]

200200
10010010000200
1000
1000

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Use the skull sceptre to teleport to the Stronghold of Security to kill minotaurs for beginner clue scrolls.
  • Use the right skull halves dropped by the minotaurs to recharge the skull sceptre.
  • A black pickaxe is preferred, since it weighs 0 kg, thus saving a bit of run energy over any other pickaxe.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Raw trout Raw pike Iron bar
Needle Leather Thread
Hammer

Easy clues[edit | edit source]

100100
100100
1001000
1000

It is highly recommended to fill up your bank with bank fillers and the loot of gourmet impling jars, while having no placeholders of the teleport tabs, dust runes and rune pouch. This way you can quickly withdraw 10 jars, open them and bank everything without having to withdraw big stacks of items again. It is also recommended to have the 9 other items in your inventory close to each other in the bank, so that you can quickly withdraw them once you manage to find a clue scroll.

For ironmen, the recommended method of obtaining the clues is pickpocketing H.A.M. members.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Lunar spellbook - Law, cosmic and astral runes in the rune pouch.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Ring of wealth Music cape Steel key ring
Combat bracelet Quest point cape Digsite pendant
Desert amulet 4 Achievement diary cape Rope
Explorer's ring 4 Ardougne cloak 4 Charge dragonstone jewellery scroll

Medium clues[edit | edit source]

100100
100100
100100
1000

It is highly recommended to fill up your bank with bank fillers and the loot of eclectic impling jars, while having no placeholders of the teleport tabs, soul runes and rune pouch. This way you can quickly withdraw 10 jars, open them and bank everything without having to withdraw big stacks of items again. It is also recommended to have the 16 other items in your inventory close to each other in the bank, so that you can quickly withdraw them once you manage to find a clue scroll.

If you don't have the achievement diary cape, substitute it with the steel key ring.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Lunar spellbook - Law, cosmic and astral runes in the rune pouch.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Rope Desert amulet 4 Steel key ring

Medium clues (hunting your own implings)[edit | edit source]

11
5000

This is a possible setup for player who wish to hunt their own Eclectic implings as a source of medium clues, while solving them as they go. This setup assumes you drop or alchemize the non-stackable loot from implings on the spot. If you want to keep the loot, simply bank them and refer to the other medium clue setup instead. This can be used by ironmen who cannot buy the implings but want to complete the clues as fast as possible. Adjust the inventory depending on the teleports you have available in your player owned house, for example it is worth saving the inventory space if you have a Jewellery box and replacing it with more jars or other useful items (see below). Use standard spellbook for the teleports and casting Snare/Entangle on implings you fail to catch as they spawn.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Mud battlestaff providing runes for Snare/Entangle and teleports.
  • Tome of fire (charged) providing runes for teleports and High alchemy.
  • Slayer ring for teleports, mainly a close to fairy ring teleport.
  • Graceful outfit because run energy is important in Puro-Puro.
  • Drakan's medallion for unlimited teleports close to bank (optional).
  • Rada's blessing 3 or 4 for teleport.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Magic butterfly net
  • Spade
  • Teleportation jewellery unavailable in player-owned house. (Games necklace, Skills necklace, Xeric's talisman, Necklace of passage and a Ring of dueling. Optional: Ring of wealth, Combat bracelet, Amulet of glory)
  • Other teleportation methods, including a Master scroll book and Kharedst's memoirs.
  • Dramen staff unless elite tier of Lumbridge & Draynor Diary has been completed.
  • Rune pouch containing Nature runes (for Snare/Entangle and High alchemy), Law runes (teleports) and Air runes (teleports, dropped by Eclecting implings)
  • Noted stackable impling drops you intend to keep. (Possibilities are: Gold bar, Oak plank, Adamantite ore (rare), Watermelon seed (rare) and Slayer's respite (rare).)
  • Jar generator
  • Space for stacking reward caskets.
  • Coins (produced by alching). May be required for transportation payments (Charter ship, Carpet rides).
  • Several free spaces (at least 3 for emote clues).
  • Rest Impling jars

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Rope Desert amulet 4 Steel key ring
Ardougne cloak 4 Ring of wealth (5) Combat bracelet(6)

Hard clues (from implings)[edit | edit source]

200200
200200200

It is highly recommended to fill up your bank with bank fillers and the loot of magpie or ninja impling jars, while having no placeholders of the runes, rune pouch, master scroll book and ectophial. This way you can quickly withdraw 10 jars, open them and bank everything without having to withdraw big stacks of items again. It is also recommended to have the 16 other items in your inventory close to each other in the bank, so that you can quickly withdraw them once you manage to find a clue scroll.

Only fill your master scroll book with about 20 teleport scrolls each to minimise your risk when entering the wilderness.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Lunar spellbook - Cosmic, mist and lava runes in the rune pouch.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Any axe Any machete Achievement diary cape
Camulet Xeric's talisman Teleport crystal
Goblin village sphere Skull sceptre Royal seed pod
Pharaoh's sceptre

Hard clues (other sources)[edit | edit source]

200
200
200

Bank the Xeric's talisman and master scroll book in case of a high level Wilderness step.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Standard spellbook

Elite clues[edit | edit source]

200200200
200200
20

It's recommended to have the required Sherlock items close to each other in your bank. These items are listed on this page: list of items for elite clues at Sherlock.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Lunar spellbook - Astral, law and cosmic runes in the rune pouch.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Varrock teleport Lumbridge teleport Ardougne teleport
Kharyrll teleport Watchtower teleport Camelot teleport
Rune thrownaxe Mirror shield

Master clues[edit | edit source]

When you have a high level wilderness step it is recommended to bank the Xeric's talisman, master scroll book and slayer ring (eternal).

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • While an abyssal bracelet isn't necessary to complete any steps, it is very useful to keep yourself unskulled for all the steps that require you to traverse to the Abyss.

Bank[edit | edit source]

It's recommended to have the required Sherlock and Falo the Bard items close to each other in your bank, as well as high strength, ranged attack and magic attack bonus equipment:

  • Sherlock challenges
  • Falo the Bard items

Some other items that are useful to have stored in your bank are:

Item Item Item
Void knight top Void knight robe Void knight gloves
Unholy symbol Unholy blessing Ring of visibility
Ancient staff Clockwork suit Abyssal bracelet
Unpowered orb Lockpick Any pickaxe
Any axe Air runes Cosmic runes
Any machete

Solving the Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

See the table below for links to the pages with solutions for each clue.

==Clue scroll sources==
Opening impling jars is by far the quickest method to find clue scrolls. For some clue scroll levels it can get rather expensive however. Therefore there'll also be some other methods being mentioned in this section.

===Other methods===
See this section for the best methods outside opening impling jars. Click the links below for a complete list of drop sources.

====Beginner clue scrolls====
{{Main|Clue scroll (beginner)#Drop sources}}
*Killing [[Bryophyta]] or [[Obor]] for a guaranteed beginner clue scroll drop.
*Killing [[hill giant]]s for a 1/50
*Killing minotaurs for a 1/60 drop rate of a beginner clue scroll.

====Easy clue scrolls====
{{Main|Clue scroll (easy)#Drop sources}}
*Pickpocketing [[H.A.M. Member]]s for a 1/50 chance of an easy clue scroll.
*Killing [[thug]]s with a [[ring of wealth (i)]] equipped for a 1/64 drop rate.
*Killing [[swamp crab]]s for a 1/96 drop rate. 
*Killing [[goblin]]s for a 1/128 drop rate of an easy clue scroll. Their low hitpoints and great numbers in a tight space make it very easy for players to get clue scrolls this way.

====Medium clue scrolls====
{{Main|Clue scroll (medium)#Drop sources}}
*Killing [[guard]]s in [[Falador]], after completion of the [[Falador Diary|Falador medium diary]], for a 1/106 drop rate of a medium clue scroll.
*Killing [[pyrefiend]]s in the [[Wilderness God Wars Dungeon]] with a [[ring of wealth (i)]] equipped for a 1/64 drop rate of a medium clue scroll.
*Looting the [[Stone chest]] for a 1/100 rate of a medium clue scroll drop rate. The fast respawn can compensate for the lower rate.

====Hard clue scrolls====
{{Main|Clue scroll (hard)#Drop sources}}
*Killing [[hellhound]]s in wilderness with a [[ring of wealth (i)]] equipped for a 1/32 drop rate of a hard clue scroll.
*Killing [[Skotizo]] for a guaranteed hard clue scroll.
*Killing [[Warped Jelly|warped jellies]] for a drop rate 1/64 as well as additional ones through totem pieces they drop.
*Killing the [[Dagannoth Kings]] for a 1/42 drop rate of a hard clue scroll.
*Killing [[Sarachnis]] for a 1/40 drop rate of a hard clue scroll.
*Looting the [[Chest (Rogues' Castle)|Rogue chest]] for a 1/99 drop rate.

====Elite clue scrolls====
{{Main|Clue scroll (elite)#Drop sources}}
*Killing [[Skotizo]] for a 1/5 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
*Killing [[lava dragon]]s with a [[ring of wealth (i)]] equipped for a 1/125 chance of an elite clue scroll.
*Killing [[Sarachnis]] for a 1/60 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
*Looting the [[Barrows]] [[Chest (Barrows)|chest]] after killing all six Barrows brothers for a 1/33 chance of an elite clue scroll.
*Killing [[Callisto]], [[Venenatis]] or [[Vet'ion]] with a [[ring of wealth (i)]] equipped for a 1/50 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
*Killing [[Vorkath]] for a 1/65 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.
*Killing [[Zulrah]] for a 1/75 drop rate of an elite clue scroll.

====Master clue scrolls====
{{Main|Clue scroll (master)#Drop sources}}
*Giving one of each easy, medium, hard and elite clues to [[Watson]] in exchange for a master clue scroll.
*Completing an easy clue scroll for a 1/50 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.
*Completing a medium clue scroll for a 1/30 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.
*Completing a hard clue scroll for a 1/15 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.
*Completing an elite clue scroll for a 1/5 chance of receiving a master clue scroll.

==Setups==
{{Main|Treasure Trails/Full guide}}
See the sections below for the most efficient setups for each clue scroll level. For more information see their individual guides on the page linked above.

<tabber>

{{Equipment

| | | |
|Black pickaxe | Spade | |
|Fly fishing rod |Feather\1000 | |
|Fishing rod |Fishing bait\1000 |Bronze axe |Gold necklace
}}

====Inventory====
*Use the [[skull sceptre]] to teleport to the [[Stronghold of Security]] to kill [[minotaur]]s for beginner clue scrolls.
*Use the [[Right skull half|right skull halves]] dropped by the minotaurs to recharge the skull sceptre.
*The [[chef's hat]] can be swapped for any [[full helm]] if more defence bonuses are needed.
*If your [[Defence]] level is high enough to easily kill minotaurs, you can choose to bank the platebody and legs for weight reduction purposes.
*A [[black pickaxe]] is preferred, since it weighs 0 kg, thus saving a bit of run energy over any other pickaxe.

====Bank====

It is highly recommended to fill up your bank with [[bank filler]]s and the loot of [[gourmet impling jar]]s, while having no placeholders of the [[Magic tablet|teleport tabs]], [[dust rune]]s and [[rune pouch]]. This way you can quickly withdraw 10 jars, open them and bank everything without having to withdraw big stacks of items again. It is also recommended to have the 9 other items in your inventory close to each other in the bank, so that you can quickly withdraw them once you manage to find a clue scroll.

For ironmen, the recommended method of obtaining the clues is pickpocketing H.A.M. members.

====Inventory====
*[[Lunar spells|Lunar spellbook]] - [[Law rune|Law]], [[Cosmic rune|cosmic]] and [[astral rune]]s in the [[rune pouch]].

This way you can quickly withdraw 10 jars, open them and bank everything without having to withdraw big stacks of items again. Medium clues (hunting your own implings) =

===Medium clues (hunting your own implings)===
{{Equipment
|align = right
|head = Graceful hood
|cape = Graceful cape
|neck = Drakan's medallion
|ammo = Rada's blessing 4
|weapon = Mud battlestaff
|torso = Graceful top
|legs = Graceful legs
|shield = Tome of fire
|gloves = Graceful gloves
|boots = Graceful boots
|ring = Slayer ring (eternal)
}}

{{Inventory|align=right
|Magic butterfly net |Spade |Games necklace(8) |Skills necklace
|Kharedst's memoirs |Master scroll book (empty)| Necklace of passage  |Ring of dueling
|Xeric's talisman |Dramen staff|Gold bar;n |Oak plank;n
|Rune pouch |Jar generator|Reward casket (medium)\1 |Coins\5000
|Impling jar|Impling jar |Impling jar |Impling jar
|Impling jar|Impling jar |Impling jar |Impling jar
| | | |
}}
{{Rune pouch|align=right
|1=Law rune
|2=Air rune
|3=Nature rune
}}

This is a possible setup for player who wish to hunt their own Eclectic implings as a source of medium clues, while solving them as they go. This setup assumes you drop or alchemize the non-stackable loot from implings on the spot. If you want to keep the loot, simply bank them and refer to the other medium clue setup instead. This can be used by [[Ironman mode|ironmen]] who cannot buy the implings but want to complete the clues as fast as possible. Adjust the inventory depending on the teleports you have available in your [[player owned house]], for example it is worth saving the inventory space if you have a [[Jewellery box]] and replacing it with more jars or other useful items (see below). Use standard spellbook for the teleports and casting Snare/Entangle on implings you fail to catch as they spawn.

====Equipment====
* [[Mud battlestaff]] providing runes for Snare/Entangle and teleports.
* [[Tome of fire]] (charged) providing runes for teleports and High alchemy.
* [[Slayer ring]] for teleports, mainly a close to fairy ring teleport.
* [[Graceful outfit]] because run energy is important in Puro-Puro.
* [[Drakan's medallion]] for unlimited teleports close to bank (optional).
* [[Rada's blessing 3]] or 4 for teleport.
====Inventory====
* [[Magic butterfly net]]
* [[Spade]]
* Teleportation jewellery unavailable in player-owned house. ([[Games necklace]], [[Skills necklace]], [[Xeric's talisman]], [[Necklace of passage]] and a [[Ring of dueling]]. Optional: [[Ring of wealth]], [[Combat bracelet]], [[Amulet of glory]])
* Other teleportation methods, including a [[Master scroll book]] and [[Kharedst's memoirs]].
* [[Dramen staff]] unless elite tier of [[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]] has been completed.
* Rune pouch containing Nature runes (for Snare/Entangle and High alchemy), Law runes (teleports) and Air runes (teleports, dropped by Eclecting implings)
* Noted stackable impling drops you intend to keep. (Possibilities are: [[Gold bar]], [[Oak plank]], [[Adamantite ore]] (rare), [[Watermelon seed]] (rare) and [[Slayer's respite]] (rare).)
* [[Jar generator]]
* Space for stacking [[Reward casket (medium)|reward caskets]].
* Coins (produced by alching). May be required for transportation payments (Charter ship, Carpet rides).
* Several free spaces (at least 3 for emote clues).
* Rest [[Impling jar]]s
====Bank====

It is highly recommended to fill up your bank with [[bank filler]]s and the loot of [[Magpie impling jar|magpie]] or [[ninja impling jar]]s, while having no placeholders of the [[runes]], [[rune pouch]], [[master scroll book]] and [[ectophial]]. This way you can quickly withdraw 10 jars, open them and bank everything without having to withdraw big stacks of items again. It is also recommended to have the 16 other items in your inventory close to each other in the bank, so that you can quickly withdraw them once you manage to find a clue scroll.

Only fill your [[master scroll book]] with about 20 [[teleport scrolls]] each to minimise your risk when entering the [[wilderness]].

====Inventory====
*[[Lunar spells|Lunar spellbook]] - [[Cosmic rune|Cosmic]], [[Mist rune|mist]] and [[lava rune]]s in the [[rune pouch]].

When you have a high level wilderness step it is recommended to bank the [[Xeric's talisman]], [[master scroll book]] and [[slayer ring (eternal)]].

====Inventory====
*While an [[abyssal bracelet]] isn't necessary to complete any steps, it is very useful to keep yourself unskulled for all the steps that require you to traverse to the [[Abyss]].

====Bank====
It's recommended to have the required [[Sherlock]] and [[Falo the Bard]] items close to each other in your bank, as well as [[Armour/Highest_bonuses#Strength|high strength]], [[Armour/Highest_bonuses#Ranged|ranged attack]] and [[Armour/Highest_bonuses#Magic|magic attack]] [[Armour/Highest bonuses|bonus equipment]]:
*[[Sherlock#Master_skill_challenges|Sherlock challenges]]
*[[Falo_the_Bard|Falo the Bard items]]
